parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To buy. From agora; properly, to go to market, i.e. to purchase; specially, to redeem.
Fine linen, a linen cloth. Of uncertain origin; byssos, i.e. Bleached linen.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I take down, pull down, depose, destroy. From kata and haireomai; to lower demolish.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To wrap up, roll up in (something), wind in. From ennomos and the base of heilisso; to enwrap.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Fine linen, a linen cloth. Of uncertain origin; byssos, i.e. Bleached linen.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To put, place, lay, set, fix, establish. A prolonged form of a primary theo to place.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
A tomb, sepulcher, monument. From mneme; a remembrance, i.e. Cenotaph.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Neuter Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Neuter Singular
str2: To hew stones, cut stones. From the same as the first part of laxeutos and the base of tomoteros; to quarry.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
A rock, ledge, cliff, cave, stony ground. Feminine of the same as Petros; a rock.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To roll to, roll up against. From pros and kulioo; to roll towards, i.e. Block against.
A stone; met: of Jesus as the chief stone in a building. Apparently a primary word; a stone.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(a) a door, (b) met: an opportunity. Apparently a primary word; a portal or entrance.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A tomb, sepulcher, monument. From mneme; a remembrance, i.e. Cenotaph.
